edu.duke

Class DirectoryResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.duke.DirectoryResource

  • public class DirectoryResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The DirectoryResource class allows the user to choose one or more files from a directory (or folder) with a file selection dialog box by using the method selectedFiles. These files can then be iterated over using a for loop.

    Example usage: 

     DirectoryResource dr = new DirectoryResource();
 for (File f : dr.selectedFiles()) {
     ImageResource ir = new ImageResource(f);
     ir.draw();
 }

    This software is licensed with an Apache 2 license, see http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 for details.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectoryResource()
      Create a DirectoryResource object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> selectedFiles()
      Open a file selection dialog box to allow the user to navigate to a directory and select one or more files from the chosen directory (or folder).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectoryResource

        public DirectoryResource()
        Create a DirectoryResource object. Creating a DirectoryResource object does not open a dialog box for selecting files.

    • Method Detail

      • selectedFiles

        public java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> selectedFiles()
        Open a file selection dialog box to allow the user to navigate to a directory and select one or more files from the chosen directory (or folder). The file selection dialog box opened starts in the current project folder.
        Returns:
        an Iterable that accesses the chosen files one at a time
